description:
2019, Divergence Ratio 1.048596 (Steins Gate worldline). The near future, where a device popularly called the PokeCom, packaged with PhoneDroid OS, spreads, bringing the Augmented Reality world close to existence.

Central Tanegashima High School's Robot Research Club is in danger of losing its club status. Kaito Yashio, one of only two members, is only obsessed with robot fighting games, showing no interest in the Robo Club even in this situation. The reckless, useless club head, Akiho Senomiya, aims to complete a giant robot, struggling hard to avoid losing the club's status.

Then, one day, Kaito discovers the A.R. annotation that becomes the Kimijima Report. Written in that report is the indictment of someone named Kou Kimijima's conspiracy involving the world.

(Source: VNdb)
synonyms: ロボティクス・ノーツ

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

edges.role: Theme Song Composition  (OP1, OP2, ED1, ED2)

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiyomaru5pb)__ | __[Company Profile (MAGES)](http://mages.co.jp/about/company/)__

__Chiyomaru Shikura__ is a Japanese guitarist, novelist, voice actor, radio personality, moderator, animation planner, animation supervisor, music producer, composer, arranger and the representative director of 5pb./MAGES. 

Chiyomaru resigns as chairman and representative director of MAGES. on January 4th, 2023.

He has been the producer and lead animation planner for titles such as Chaos;Head, Steins;Gate, and Robotics;Notes. Shikura is also a very active composer and lyricist. To date, he has written over a hundred theme songs for the video games and anime adaptations he's worked on.

edges.role: Theme Song Lyrics  (OP1, OP2, ED1, ED2)

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiyomaru5pb)__ | __[Company Profile (MAGES)](http://mages.co.jp/about/company/)__

__Chiyomaru Shikura__ is a Japanese guitarist, novelist, voice actor, radio personality, moderator, animation planner, animation supervisor, music producer, composer, arranger and the representative director of 5pb./MAGES. 

Chiyomaru resigns as chairman and representative director of MAGES. on January 4th, 2023.

He has been the producer and lead animation planner for titles such as Chaos;Head, Steins;Gate, and Robotics;Notes. Shikura is also a very active composer and lyricist. To date, he has written over a hundred theme songs for the video games and anime adaptations he's worked on.

Zwei is a Japanese duo formed in 2003 composed of model Megumi Ueno (born May 24, 1980) on bass and Ayumu (born March 30, 1978) on vocals.
They are known for their SciADV songs (Robotics;Notes, Steins;Gate 0; Occultic;Nine).
They announces their break up on May 26, 2024.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.
Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).
Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daizenium)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). He often works with [Ikuo Kuwana](https://anilist.co/staff/115142/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daizenium)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). He often works with [Ikuo Kuwana](https://anilist.co/staff/115142/).
Freelancer originating from [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lainnet01)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lainnet01)
Freelancer originating from [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/).
Originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Currently freelance with a seat at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
Originating from [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tatsumi_fujii)

Fujii Tatsumi is an animator affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/).

edges.role: Animation Director (OP1, OP2, ED1, ED2, eps 1, 10, 14, 16, 21, 22)

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋英樹_(アニメーター%29)

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [actor](https://anilist.co/staff/111553/) or the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110065/)._
